name: Super Generic Roguelike #7DRL
description:
This is mine and @fembolul's submission for the #7DRLx17 Game Jam.

Team members:

Lewis Jones (https://twitter.com/LewisJGamesDev)

Femi Fernandez (https://twitter.com/femboluls)

Femi mainly worked on the artwork in the game including the tile sprites, enemies, programming the room generation and creating the sound objects. whereas I worked on the grid-based movement, UI, as well as the enemy movement, and managed the GitHub repository.

Super generic roguelike is just that - a Super generic roguelike game where you move on a grid based system. If you touch an enemy, you will kill them. However if they move onto you - you will immediately die. If you run out of turns, you will also die and have to start from the beginning.

The main objective of the game is to collect the key in each room, as well as defeat each enemy. The more rooms you complete, the harder each room becomes! When you move to the next room, you will gain a set amount of extra turns.

There are many unique map layouts, and the key and enemies will never be in the same place.

Controls:

Use WASD to move.

If you want the enemies to move without using up a turn, press the space bar.

Known issues:

Once you complete a room, if you dont go forward into the next room and instead backtrack, you will get softlocked. You can pause the game and go back to the main menu if this occurs.

Enemies may stand on top of each other.
